programme.desc: News of a trust-fund beauty (Kristin Scott Thomas) inspires the pianist (Prince) at a hotel in Nice on the Riviera.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Jenny says Luke owes her for training sessions for which she has already paid; Luke says Jenny was sexually inappropriate during their sessions, claiming she violated their working etiquette which broke their contract, therefore he owes her nothing.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.sub-title: No No in the Mo Mo
programme.desc: Burton claims Charles contacted his wife after he had a tryst at Charles' motel; he also claims Charles informed his wife of his visit with a young woman; Charles says he just called the number on the paperwork that was filled out.

programme.title: Judge Dad
programme.desc: Becky is suing former landlord, Richard, for the three months of rent she paid; she left her lease early after she discovered her landlord was spying on her; Richard is counter-suing for the remaining 9 months of rent from the signed lease.

programme.title: Judge Mom
programme.desc: Dwayne and Lisa have two kids together; Dwayne and Lisa were living together and broke up six months ago; Dwayne says he just wants to see his kids and that Lisa is using the kids to punish him for breaking up with her and moving away.

programme.desc: Julian Jimenez Castaneda was murdered on his way home from his new job.

programme.desc: Ladarius Frazer was shot after arguing with a suspect; nine people were shot in what became known as The Liberty City Massacre.

programme.title: Surviving the Game
programme.desc: Chosen to lead hunters (Rutger Hauer, Charles S. Dutton) on an expedition, a homeless man (Ice-T) discovers he is to be their prey.

programme.title: Deep Cover
programme.desc: An undercover officer (Larry Fishburne) hooks up with a lawyer (Jeff Goldblum) who deals drugs for a West Coast cartel run by a foreign diplomat.

programme.title: Bait
programme.desc: A U.S. Treasury investigator (David Morse) uses an unsuspecting petty criminal (Jamie Foxx) as bait to catch a security hacker (Doug Hutchison) who stole $40 million in gold bullion.

programme.title: 16 Blocks
programme.desc: A boozy, world-weary NYPD cop (Bruce Willis) must outwit rogue officers planning to kill a witness (Mos Def) who is set to testify against them.
